evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.defeater_resistance: There is no evidence contradicting the presence or impact of the communication/coordination breakdown among crew in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim scenario, indicating strong defeater resistance.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim data, such as timing, involved personnel, and situational context.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution for Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 is documented and available in the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim dataset.

slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation aligns with key features observed in pushback operations for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25, as captured in the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim data.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t0_prelim phase on 12-25.

assumptions: The continued movement beyond the TRP despite communication attempts indicates a coordination breakdown rather than a procedural deviation.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination with no observable breakdown or if the pushback deviation was due to mechanical failure or environmental factors rather than crew coordination.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H4 shows active communication and coordination attempts among crew and tug operators, but the pushback continued beyond the designated stop point causing a collision, indicating a communication/coordination breakdown consistent with the claim.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether the pushback continuation was due to communication failure or procedural deviation
